conclusion: Understanding the scenario of the problem involving skateboard A, spring, blocks B and C, and their interactions.
Description of the given parameters including masses, friction coefficients, and gravitational acceleration.
Focus on finding the mechanical energy loss during the collision between blocks C and B.
Determine the velocity of block C just before collision considering the friction force.
Calculate the work done by friction and the change in kinetic energy of block C.
Calculate the kinetic energy of block C just before collision using initial kinetic energy and work done by friction.
Determine the velocity of block C just before collision using kinetic energy.
Determine the velocity just after collision using conservation of momentum for perfectly inelastic collision.
Calculate the kinetic energy just after collision for the combined blocks B and C.
Calculate the mechanical energy loss during the collision by subtracting kinetic energy after collision from kinetic energy before collision.
